message.content:
cs.NA, cs.MS, cs.DC, cs.CE, cs.CG

Reasoning: 

- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper proposes a general algorithm for adaptive mesh refinement of unstructured meshes in high-order finite element codes. The focus is on h-refinement with a fixed polynomial order. The paper presents numerical experiments verifying the correctness of the algorithms and performs a parallel scaling study to show that the algorithm can adapt meshes containing billions of elements and run efficiently on a large number of parallel tasks. These aspects suggest that the paper belongs to the cs.NA sub-category.
- cs.MS (Mathematical Software): The paper proposes a general algorithm for adaptive mesh refinement of unstructured meshes in high-order finite element codes. The paper presents a flexible data structure for meshes with hanging nodes and a general procedure to construct the conforming interpolation operator, both in serial and in parallel. These aspects suggest that the paper belongs to the cs.MS sub-category.
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper performs a parallel scaling study to show that the algorithm can adapt meshes containing billions of elements and run efficiently on a large number of parallel tasks. This aspect suggests that the paper belongs to the cs.DC sub-category.
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper proposes a general algorithm for adaptive mesh refinement of unstructured meshes in high-order finite element codes. The paper illustrates the integration of dynamic AM
